claim: Nixon was referring to his personal finances when he said, I am not a crook.

supporting.text: Nixon made the statement 'I am not a crook' during a press conference in 1973, primarily addressing the Watergate scandal, not his personal finances.

attacks.text: Nixon made the statement 'I am not a crook' during a press conference in 1973, primarily addressing the Watergate scandal, not his personal finances.

The Watergate scandal was the dominant context of Nixon's presidency at the time, making it highly unlikely his statement referred to anything else.
Nixon's personal finances were under scrutiny during the Watergate investigations, so his statement could reasonably encompass both his political and personal conduct.
